scenes.location: PROFESSOR OCK"S PRIVATE PHYSICS LABORATORY, THE

dialogues.speaker: CYCLOTRON ROOM, (CREDIT SEQUENCE)
dialogues.text: A mighty WARNING KLAXON assaults our ears. A FLASHING RED WARNING LIGHT stabs our eyes. Several DIALS go into the RED. A hand pushes aside a YELLOW THERMOS and pushes forward a RED POWER THROTTLE. We hear the WHINING UP of a cyclotron. A DIGITAL DIAL climbs to "5% POWER." A SPIDER crawls across a DIAL. Begin OPENING CREDITS. THE CYCLOTRON ROOM is in an old basement full of peeling paint and plumbing wrapped with TAPE. Leaks are here and there. COBWEBS are all around. DOCTOR OTTO OCTAVIUS (OCK) is a strong but strange featured man in his mid-fifties. His assistant, WEINER, hovers nearby looking on. He's open mouthed with a mindless kind of curiosity. WEINER is a local, small-time hood hired by OCK to circumvent the school administration and to "procure" whatever OCK needs for his experiments. He shades his eyes against a searing BLUE-WHITE BEAM that erupts from the WINDOW. THE ROOM IS DIVIDED INTO A CONTROL ROOM AND THE EXPERIMENT CHAMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa... what's that? With a WHOOSH, the WINDOW EXPLODES, showering the TWO wit shards of GLASS, and throwing them to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We begin again... let's kick in that new transducer. See if we can double the power output.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising more slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, Doc... wait a minute... But OCK is already at the THROTTLE. The cyclotron whirls up. The lights go on. Louder, brighter than before. OCK looks through the broken WINDOW into the EXPERIMENTAL CHAMBER. The POWER DIAL inches upward, "eight, nine..." the BLUE-WHITE LIGHT is blinding now. The WHINE pitch is shattering. END OPENING CREDITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey... dokey! The POWER DIAL hits ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STUDENTS go to class, the sound of the cyclotron spill out of the SCIENCE CENTER onto the grounds of Empire Stat University. We see PETER PARKER, a pleasant faced senior who's among the top in his class. Sincere and serious, he has yet to develop a way with women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falling in step)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya Peter... LIZ ALLEN is also a senior. She's beautiful and intelligent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ardent but uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya Liz... how're you doing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'm I doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter! Peter! Wait up! HARRY is the school nerd. A quirky kid who, like PETER, can be a little backward around girls, especially pretty ones like Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Liz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you, uh... excuse us for a minute? Despite PETER'S protesting body language, HARRY pulls him away like a conspirator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the Astro-Physics Journal really accept your paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well... all I got's the data but they've agreed to publish it when it's finished. You know... it's my calculation on the Planetary Conjunction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And its influence on the anti-force. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Look, Harry, I am busy with... (indicates Liz standing there)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you and the rest of the class. Every one is busy with Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter? A HAND reaches in and smacks her bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, cupcakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (elbowing him affectionately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash...! They kiss and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sneering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Flash is the busiest of them all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Harry... we'll be late for Octavius. HARRY makes a gesture dismissing OCK as crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ock is nuts, don't you agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ock is a genius, Harry. Crazy, Yes! But, a genius misunderstood, and unappreciated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a basement hallway full of LOCKERS which STUDENTS are banging open and shut as they put stuff in and take stuff out. In their midst, a MAN is banging on the door marked "Cyclotron Room - Authorized Personnel Only!" Professor ROSOMORF, SIXTISH, respectable, a good old fashioned professor, he's the head of the Physics Dept. With him is ALEXANDER THORKEL, a 40-ish, Waspish school administrator. For a scientist as crazily focused as OCK, THORKEL is a natural enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocking furiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Octavius! You are late for your lecture. The students are waiting. Doctor Octavius!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend is impossible Professor Rosomorf, I told the board we should let him go. The LIGHT above THORKEL's head EXPLODES. Then all the LIGHTS behind him EXPLODE in succession. THORKEL and ROZ look amazed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing in there, not his crazy experiment again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean his anti-force theory... one day they'll give him the Nobel Prize for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile he is demolishing our university. Octavius!! (knocks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anti-force experiment has now reached the limit of electronic overload safety. Therefore, Weiner, you will disconnect the overload safety device... FOUR WALDOS (three-fingered, snake-like mechanical arms) suddenly thrust themselves into the CHAMBER and begin working, each at a different task. OCK is an acknowledged master at manipulating these WALDOS. He flicks a switch and a searing BLUE-WHITE BEAM lances down from a FOCUSING CONE and strikes a GRAM WEIGHT marked, "1,000,000"), illuminating it and filling our ears with a splitting BUZZ TONE. The knock on the door grows louder. WEINER comes up behind OCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, Doc... someone's at the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: World class scientific mind and they stick me in the basement with this third rate cyclotron... INSERT: The DIAL marked "RELATIVE GRAVITY" reads "1,000,000" but suddenly it snaps to "0.999999!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey! Dokey! The WEIGHT begins to jiggle and, for an instant, it appears to lift ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an enormous room, 100 lab tables. The yellowing smoke of a thousand experiments hangs in the air. A HUGE AMERICAN FLAG dominates the back wall. PETER, HARRY and LIZ set up their TABLES. FLASH reads the DAILY BUGLE sports section. PETER can't take his eyes off LIZ. When she looks back he looks down at his GEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEINER opens the door and sees ROZ and THORKEL waiting impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, gentleman can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your boss, that his class is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better tell him yourself. THORKEL looks at ROZ who waves his shoulder, then the bot call. ROZ & THORKEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Octavius!! Professor OCK turns and looks at the bewildered men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, come, you must see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, your students...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The imbeciles can wait... I have better things to do than teach introductory Physics Rosomorf. Undergrads are kindless adolescence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see he is impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorkel you are the dummiest administrator our university has ever had. (Thorkel turns to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go Thorkel!! Come! Look! He starts to play his machines handles and buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The university pays you to teach something to your students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you mean nothing... or do you mean something but you won't tell me what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean plain nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that's about as nothing as you can get... plain nothing. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, it is something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... look. The equipment on her TABLE is starting to vibrate. They look at it, curiously. We hear the cyclotron's WHINE begin to build...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is shaking like in an earthquake... Roz and Thorkel seem to dance in their place going crazy with anger and surprise. The WHINE is deafening! The light is blinding! WEINER has his eyes closed and his hands over his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going for 20 percent power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!! Don't do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ock! Its dangerous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ock I warn you... WEINER crosses himself. The CONSOLE erupts in sparks.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: We follow the electrical overcharge as it crackles along the WIRES and CABLES inside the WALLS and FLOORS. It is making its way up to the LAB!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids are now trying to hold onto their vibrating equipment. The CHARGE crackles up a WIRE and erupts at LIZ'S TABLE. A BREAKER explodes in flames. There is an outburst of AD LIBS: "Fire!" "Everybody out!" THORKEL (comes running he is shabby and bewildered) seein LIZ trapped behind the fire which is growing from second to second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep calm, everybody keep calm. Use the front door. Everybody out the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz! Come on...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming! He wades into the fire, but is beaten back by the FLAMES. His sleeve is on fire. He pats it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter! Flash appears and tries to help but Thorkel stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back, you idiots. You can't go in there! LIZ smashes at the WINDOW, but this is an inner city school and the WINDOWS are covered by STEEL GATES. Liz wraps her fingers in the GATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out at the street)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Help me! Outside the WINDOW the air is clear and people come and go. Some are stopping to look up at the girl on the second floor who screams (but they can't hear, of course) down at them as the FLAMES close in behind her. PETER comes flying in with a FIRE EXTINGUISHER. He fumbles with it. FLASH pushes Thorkel, grabs the extinguisher away from him with a scowl of disdain. LIZ turns to face the FLAMES. Suddenly there is an eruption of CO2 CLOUDS and the roar of a FIRE EXTINGUISHER. The FLAMES are beaten down enough for her to leap out. FLASH is there, holding the EXTINGUISHER. People CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help Flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem wimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our hero has a real way with words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, why don't you grow up. PETER is stung, insulted, turns away. ROSOMORF peeps in, worried -- faces Thorkel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man will bring a disaster upon this university. OCK comes in, starts his lecture calmly as if nothing has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universe is made up of forces... and counter-forces. Science is the study of the forces! FLASH hands the EXTINGUISHER to PETER. LIZ embraces FLASH, throwing a glimpse at PETER who tried so bravely. He looks away and turns the last of the EXTINGUISHER on the last of the FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues without a hitch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I... Professor Otto Octavius... have devoted my life to the study of the counter-forces! Good job, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking place at lab table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Professor. THORKEL has walked slowly and uncomprehendingly toward th front of the huge LAB. He simply cannot believe OCK'S behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it, I simply don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we carry on Mr. Thorkel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe... oh, all right carry on Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! This week my dear students I have made a stunning breakthrough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute... you've got fire forms to fill out, Dr. Octavius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no time for forms, or administrators who persist in interrupting me, Mr. Thorkel. THORKEL steams out and bangs shut the DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I now believe its possible that these counter forces can be... collected... the way the magnifying glass collects the sunlight... and focused into a hard beam I call... Weiner! WEINER backs away from the BLACKBOARD to reveal a word that OCK has scrawled in large letters. It says "Anti- Force."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call it, the Anti-Force! OCK is plugging a HUGE CABLE into a small LUCITE BOX with a SILVER BALL inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues as he works)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This anti-force, once harnessed, is capable of undoing any natural force at which it is aimed... for instance... (looks up maniacally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity! LIZ scribbles down a note and mouths the word "gravity." Then she turns to PETER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. OCK is "playing" his COMPUTER like the Phantom of the Opera at the organ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We patch in the cyclotron... The lights flicker and go dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay no attention to the lights... I of course steal its energy, and it looses power. We patch in the cyclotron... and we gradually apply power. The power that I am stealing... As the WHINE builds in the LAB... OCK peers through the LUCITE BOX at us, distorted by it. The BOX is a miniature version of the cyclotron's experimental chamber, and now the BLUE-WHITE glow begins. It crackles round the SILVER BALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so we stand, four square against the fundamental force that orders and maintains our universe... gravity... which is holding down this goddamn ball. Rise! The LIGHTS go totally dark. The kids react with WHOOPS and CATCALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a crock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Harry... this is very interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Parker! Have you some... interesting observation you'd like to share with the class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then shut up! And pay some attention to the experiment. OCK peers at us through the LUCITE BOX as the SILVER BALL begins to rise. OCK'S face is ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise! Rise!!! The SILVER BALL suddenly shoots up, shattering the top of the box. It flies up to the ceiling where it shatters a LIGHT FIXTURE. The shards rain down on OCK who reaches out and catches the falling BALL and scales it in a raised fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's what I call an experiment! The CYCLOTRON WHINE cuts out and OCK wheels to the COMPUTER. He hits a KEY and several COLORED PROJECTION BEAMS lance out of the back of the room. They pierce the smoke and light a PROJECTION DISPLAY in the front. TWO COLORED SPHERES one, YELLOW, one BLUE touch where their circumferences meet. Behind them is a BLACK depiction of "space".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are looking at a representation of two universes. Our Blue one. Our real universe... something we can touch and feel and see and draw calculations about. This is us. The Yellow universe... this is something else. Some other dimension... something... on the other side! OCK hits another COMPUTER KEY and a hole appears where th TWO SPHERES touch. The BLUE AND THE YELLOW MARBLEIZE with each other. The colors swirl until both SPHERES are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it were possible to generate enough power behind it, the anti-force could wipe out not just gravity... but all our universal forces at the same time. In effect... it would blast a hole between this universe and the next. Each... (indicates green spheres)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: would flow into each other. No blue universe. No yellow. End, finished, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a student's ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like a scenario for the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girl, it is! It is. It would mean wiping out everything that's known... and letting in everything that's unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that a little dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry yourself, true inter- dimensional penetration is still purely theoretical, but one day... Maybe very near... maybe in the 21st century...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER, LIZ, FLASH and HARRY all take BOOKS from their LOCKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's just... I don't know... when you and Flash go after each other like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And besides, he's not all bad. PETER looks at FLASH who's a few LOCKERS down. FLASH has taken a FOOTBALL from his LOCKER and is spinning it on hi finger with great joy and concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get nicknamed Flash because you're a rocket scientist, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up, Parker. You'd die for a nickname like Flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of embarrassment. KIM comes by and leans seductively by her LOCKER. KIM is a ripe one and hot-hot-hot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Flash... I'm scalping a pair of the Midnight Madness Wrestling Match tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slammies??? I'd kill for that!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you pay $125?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, I... gee... if... can I tell you tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You snooze, you lose. Hiya Liz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim, you know Peter and Harry? This is my new roommate... Kim Nickson. KIM is pulling her pet, a foot long SALAMANDER, out of he LOCKER. She wraps it around her neck and turns to the boys. They go bug-eyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellooo, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the Student Reunion Meeting. You coming? Peter looks at KIM. Wow. Then he looks at LIZ who's adjusting herself in a small MIRROR. HARRY jabs him in the ribs. Yeah, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... I gotta go over to the Daily Bugle. I'm trying to sell some photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soooh, a photographer...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an amateur. Well... nice meeting you, Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I bet it would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I be your date for the reunion ShooShoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Jerk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she turns to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what you said, it's how you say it, ShooShoo! Everybody leaves and Harry is left alone, he throws his bag down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! PETER turns to go and comes face to face with the hulking WEINER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Doc Ock wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About my data I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows about my work on the Planetary Conjunction, doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER enters wide-eyed behind WEINER. This place is a far cry from the experiment in the LAB ROOM. It's a fantastic netherworld to which no undergrad gains entrance. No one but PETER. OCK is sitting in a swivel CHAIR with his back to PETER. He has the look of Captain Nemo in his Nautilus. This is OCK'S domain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Professor Octavius. (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really admired your experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a lot of interests in common, Peter. Perhaps we should put our heads together, if you know what I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flattered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be... great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you take the Planetary Conjunction. This Saturday night we will witness Saturn, Jupiter, the Moon, the Earth, the Sun... all in a row. Never seen within the memory of man, or measured for its effect. The total gravitational force must be quite exceptional. Isn't that the subject of your paper...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I've worked out a new way to calculate the combined gravitational effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a busy man, Mr. Parker. But I think I could find the time to go over it with you. Make sure it all... checks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm sort of working with Professor Rosomorf and he suggested we kind of keep it between us. He thinks that my theory is... well, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scoundrel... (turns angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see that data, Peter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Professor Octavius... if I knew you were interested... sorry, I've already given it to... Professor Rosomorf, and he is after all the head of our Physics Department... and I couldn't... OCK turns sweet again. He smiles too broadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm certain something can be worked out. Run along, young man. PETER begins to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute... how about if I show you my discoveries... something I never showed to any other student... as a matter of fact to anybody at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I am really flattered, I mean I'd love to... but I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well shall we say if you come here tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Professor I don't now if I should...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it eight sharp... I'll be waiting for you... Right here... Peter looks worried then leaves. OCK turns to WEINER who slouches against the wall smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same academic world that's so keen to embrace that boy's undergraduate work, ridicules my anti-force theory as quackery. I ask you, Weiner... what is our society coming to? Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all a bunch of brainless assholes, that's what I say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiner! Go get me that boy's data!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cost you fifty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Weiner hissing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get it. We'll negotiate your fee when you have the data, alright Weiner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish as ART DECO BUILDING well beyond its prime. A sign says: "The Daily Bugle." Peter enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garbage! Absolute, 100% garbage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very forties, very messy. J. Jameson scans some PHOTOS as PETER stands helplessly by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bag ladies. I hate bag ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. JAMESON is 50ish, grey at the temples, brush cut on top. He too is forties. His chewed up CIGAR is forties. This guy is a hard case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the other photos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little kids... I hate little kids. This is a daily newspaper. We need news value photographs, not artsy-fartsy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. JAMESON comes to a picture of a BUSINESS SUITED MAN with MOHAWK. PETER smiles in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid? You want a pro's assessment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing photos back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your photos suck. (cigar for emphasis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, my readers are morons. I gotta grab them by the eyes. Every time you press the button of that Nikon of yours it costs you fifty-five cents. So the next time you're about to take the plunge, ask yourself, am I taking dog bites man? Because if you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. You want man bites dog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, this is the post modern 20th century. I want man eats dog! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seedy east village walk up. Peter takes his camera and takes various shots of a wino. ALL IN. He climbs the stairs to his building, looks through the mail, he collects from a beaten down mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rent! Rent, more bills, rent... electricity, bills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A one-room, shabby roof apartment, a chaos of books and papers. A photo enlarger and darkroom baths in kitchen pots; 8x10s tacked to the walls; a spare camera and lenses. Self-consciously wacky kitsch; plastic dinosaurs, wind-up toys, a stuffed carp. An unmade bed and a 50's dinette set are the only furniture. A grimy skylight leads to the roof. It's not a pretty place, but it has personality. A voice from the kitchen, a shadow of an intruder, is sneaking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing in there worth stealing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from within the kitchen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the understatement of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt May, you're trespassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just so desperately bored... I thought I'd come over and make you dinner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am old enough to... to make my own--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't feel like getting to know your roaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll introduce you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. And those foul chemicals in the pots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take pictures, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I've decided to kidnap you for dinner in Forest Hills... She grabs her coat, crosses back to Peter and tugs on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Friday night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Do you have a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark and empty except for COMPUTERS. Sitting at it, lit by the GLOW of its screen, is SOLOMON ROSOMORF (ROZ). As he works, a DOOR opens behind him. Someone walks quietly through the LAB. ROSOMORF keeps working. The intruder approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at his ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Rosomorf, what happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone tried to rob me of some paper... I suspect they were looking for that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unruffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Award winning stuff. (turning slightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Parker's data on the Planetary Conjunction. Damn lucky I hid it in my computer under another title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, what's going on in our school? First Professor Octavius almost blows up the Physics lab... Now this. You report it in triplicate, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorkel, be careful when you talk to Octavius. Remember... the man is a very fragile genius. One day he'll bring us all the Noble Prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosomorf, the man is a very dangerous crackpot! Off screen the voice of the CYCLOTRON WHINE begins to build.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him again. He's working day and night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you the man is very dangerous. (the whine grows louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Rosomorf, let's stop him before this building will explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCK and WEINER are at work as before. OCK takes no notice of the TWO MEN who come in, nor the WORKER who comes in behind them and sets to work attaching a BIG LOCK to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it down, Octavius. OCK ignores him. WEINER touches OCK'S shoulder. OCK ignores him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've blown half the circuits in the Science Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call an electrician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have called the locksmith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what is he doing. He points toward the worker who's working on the lock on the main door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to shut your lab down and take a look at the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Otto, we must lock it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thorkel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're denying me access to my cyclotron?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. OCK glares back and forth between the TWO MEN, the WORKER and WEINER. Then he pulls BACK the RED POWER THROTTLE. The WHINE descends. The WALDOS pull back and dangle from their panel. The WHINE dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemplating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey, dokey... just give me till tomorrow. I want to clean up my papers. Tomorrow... Ha... Tomorrow you can have this room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... well Thorkel... few more hours won't make a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope. He signals to the worker to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The N.Y. Mets are playing baseball on T.V. PETER watches with his UNCLE BEN, a paunchy 65 years old in POLYESTER SLACKS and a COMFY OLD SWEATER. A N.Y. METS CAP is perched on BEN'S head. A BEER CAN is in his hand. A cluttered but familiar living room sprawls comfortably around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another brewski?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine, Uncle Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah! Way to do it. Alright! (to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't follow the Mets like you used to, do you, Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not so much anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. When your Mom and Dad, uh, passed away... I had this idea... I wanted you to be the best baseball player that ever was. Geez, what ever happened to that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little league.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft and warm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Babe Ruth you wasn't. AUNT MAY enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the table! Turn off the TV! BEN nods, rises sluggishly and slowly, and turns the soun off only. PETER moves toward his AUNT in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that girl you told us about, Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz? She's great... But she has a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER passes AUNT MAY and takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy your age should have a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt May... she has a steady boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, any girl that's worth your attention is of course gonna have a boyfriend... But if she really gets to know what you have to offer she'll... you get my drift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just leave him alone, okay. When he's ready for girls he'll be a holy terror. (winks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the blood. (now serious business)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookit, how are you fixed for money, Pete? Maybe I can help you out a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying to them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm alright. My scholarship covers almost everything, and I sell some photos here and there. Today my physics professor asked for some of my work... he wants to study my data. They might publish my work in the science magazine... that'll bring me some money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (practically cheering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Publish your work?! You hear that May...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in fact I have to leave a little early tonight, to meet Professor Octavius... He offered me to be his assistant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Did you hear that May...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Peter, you promised you'd spend the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I can't, Aunt May. Professor Octavius wants to discuss my new findings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, what you should be finding... is a nice girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEINER is eating a large SANDWICH and a drinking a COKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show them... closing the cyclotron on me... Weiner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Professor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? It's ten past eight o'clock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mouth full)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be him. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are late. (to Weiner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiner, go outside and get us something to eat. And don't steal it! Just buy it. I'll reimburse you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want anything Parker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, I just had dinner at my aunt's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off, Weiner! WEINER leaves. PETER wanders around. He goes into the experimental chamber, he overlooks the SPIDER which is scuttling away and crawls inside the open WINDOW... and into the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey, dokey, Parker... how would you like to take Weiner's place... I mean, be my assistant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Professor, that would be a great honor, but I'm already working with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosomorf... that imbecile. Don't you understand, kid, that I am about to uncover the greatest discovery since Einstein came up with his theory of relativity... The "Anti-Force."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! The theory of the Anti-force! You should go for the Noble Prize Professor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noble Shmoble, I am going for a much bigger prize kid. Okey, dokey. Let me show you, kid, what I got here. OCK begins the experiment. We move in past the shattered WINDOW. We see the SPIDER crawling on the chamber's GEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present maximum anti-force power to date is 38 percent of theoretical limit. I have patched in the variable particle-wave accelerator... (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will now try to reach 50% power... (big breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if your paper has any value... I can use it to get the power I'm missing to create the anti-force, to break through and beat any other form of power in our or any other universe, capish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Professor, I can't do it. I gave my word to Professor Rosomorf. OCK is angry... Ock now sees the SPIDER. He shoots out a WALDO to try and crush it but the SPIDER is too fast. The WALDO slams against the wall of the chamber. He starts to push every button or switch in sight. A deafening whining starts. An URGENT WARNING TONE causes OCK to look at the "Relativ Gravity" DIAL. It is at "4.999999KG" but suddenly the numbers start to tumble rapidly. INSERT: The glowing 5KG WEIGHT. INSERT: The POWER DIAL inches toward 50% POWER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 percent... anti-force... 50 percent... that's all I'm missing! Parker, we can be rich together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I'd better go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really angry now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be sorry, Parker. PETER leaves. Another URGENT WARNING TONE causes OCK to look at the monitor SCREEN. On it, flashing RED, is the word, "OVERLOAD!" OCK pushes the RED POWER THROTTLE forward! The WHINE increases to a PULSE and THROB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredibly lit, the SPIDER is dropping on it's shimmering WEB-STRAND down toward the 5KG WEIGHT which now GLOWS in time with the THROB and PULSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MONITOR is flashing "MAXIMUM OVERLOAD - SHUT DOWN!" OCK continues with the experiment. And then he sees the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Get out of there, you creeping... He tries to shove the SPIDER with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the BLUE-WHITE we can barely make out OCK on the other side if the shattered WINDOW. He sends TWO WALDOS after the SPIDER. The SPIDER evades him and jumps onto the PROFESSOR's back. It then climbs onto the PROFESSOR's neck and bites him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooooooooo! The gravity DIAL goes to .000001, then pops back up as OCK'S tiny world goes berserk. DIALS spin, crack, explode or droop liquidly. WIRES dance on the CONSOLE which erupts like the 4th of JULY. OCK begins to float. His shirt begins to tear away. A DIAL floats by with its pulled WIRES undulating like a Medusa. WALDOS smash through the walls and flail like snakes. OCK'S YELLOW THERMOS distorts and EXPLODES! OCK, his hair wild, face locked in a multi-G grimace, is pinned halfway up a wall that is showering the room with SPARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstasy above the din)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an energy storm! Okey! Dokey! We see clearly the SPIDER still stuck to his neck. The big beast buffets and shakes. Tubes, junctions, valves and whatnot fall off, crashing to the floor where they twitch and writhe with a life of their own. Then, an enormous EXPLOSION rips a large hole in the CYCLOTRON's side, sending debris and a HUNDRED MICRO- STREAMS of ELECTRONIC PARTICLES lancing in our direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultimate weirdness! The PULSING BLUE-WHITE LIGHT penetrates first the DOOR of the CYCLOTRON ROOM and then the very walls! LOCKERS bang, LAMPS POP, the ceiling sags in a SURREAL, RUBBERY way. The WALLS sag too! The CYCLOTRON SIGN pivots and embeds itself in a WALL. A LADDER sinks in the WALL. The BLUE- WHITE LIGHT dances wildly about in PULSES. Then, suddenly, it stops... DEAD SILENCE. WEINER comes running in holding a double decker sandwich and a large bottle of Pepsi. Weiner enters OCK'S lab, singing, not at first noticing what's going on. Suddenly he stops dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scene out of DALI's surrealistic canvas. There are things inside of other things. DIALS look like DALI watches. This place has been rippled to the max! OCK lays face up, unconscious on the floor, a WALDO acros his chest. The SPIDER is weaving its web. CAMERA slowly DOWN to see OCK. PIPES and WIRES are stuck to his body. The WALDO seems to be wrapping him. He wakes up to see those MECHANICAL ARMS buried in his body. They weave around him as if they are looking for prey. He tries to tear them out, but they seem to be a part of his body, like his other limbs. He screams. Suddenly Weiner sees OCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor... what happened to you? What did you do... Suddenly one of the waldos hits him so strongly that he flies back and out through the door to the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... what happened here... He hears the police sirens approaching, he runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The long SCREAM segues to a POLICE SIREN. A COP CAR pulls to a halt in front of the COLLEGE. Many NYPD CARS are already there, along with a NUCLEAR REGULATORY VAN, some AMBULANCES, a VAN from the ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENC and TWO TV VANS. ROZ runs across the lawn. POLICE STRUGGLE to hold back the crowd of press, students and general gawkers. J. JAMESON pushes to the front of the mob in time to see TWO COPS hustle a BUGLE PHOTOGRAPHER back into it. The MAN shakes his head. JAMESON throws down his CIGAR, stomps it, and pulls out a fresh one. THORKEL arrives to address the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through bull horn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no danger. Please go back to your dorms. I repeat, there is no danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaches him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spill it out, Professor! The public wants to know! The CROWD closes on THORKEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jameson, Daily Bugle, Chief Editor, now what really happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be a press announcement in the morning Mr. Jameson... now if you'll excuse me. This elicits a flood of AD LIBS: "I heard a terrible explosion?" "Nuclear accidents?" "Meltdown?" "Genetic engineering?" "Are you guys making mutants in there?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing to say... there will be an announcement. Now, please go home... everybody... we must clear the grounds... In the back of the crowd are PETER, HARRY, LIZ, FLASH and KIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'll cancel classes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must... the whole building must be contaminated with some kind of poisonous gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about nuclear contaminations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... lets beat it. But nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more interested in other things)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could anyone be in there, Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Maybe Professor Octavius. He usually works late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That nut, I bet it was all his doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Parker! Peter Parker! PETER pushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jameson! What are you doing here? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for them to know, and for you to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, they wouldn't tell us. You heard Thorkel... he said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A press announcement tomorrow...! But we must know tonight Parker. This is your university, right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, but I can't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred dollars says you can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside and get pictures, fifty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said a hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy, but I want blood and gore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeya guys. He dashes off. FLASH shakes his head in dismay at this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To make fifty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER approaches a CYCLONE FENCE keeping low and out of sight. He leaps it like a skirmisher but fails ignominiously in a heap. He's torn his PANTS and cut his leg. He moves to the side of the building. A DUMPSTER sits next to a FIRE DOOR. It's locked. As PETER mulls over his next move, the LOCK clicks and the DOOR slowly opens. PETER leaps on the DUMPSTER... and falls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER lays in the GARBAGE, a pained look on his face. He rolls over and comes face to face with a wet DAILY BUGLE. The headline reads, "Wave of Violence Rips City!" He pull himself up and peers out. He sees a UNIFORMED GUARD hold the DOOR open for THREE ME IN RADIATION SUITS who remove some weirdly fused objects. When they let the DOOR swing closed, PETER stops it by inserting the NEWSPAPER in the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER squeezes inside and jumps to knock out the NEWSPAPER. The Door closes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skewed, strange, surreal, PETER stares at the weirdness and fumbles with his CAMERA. He snaps off a few shots, then freezes when he hears a familiar voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered through face mask)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. Take it easy with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him away and never bring him back! Now we see ROZ and THORKEL following 2 GUARDS carrying OC in a stretcher. They all wear RADIATION SUITS. A waldo sneaks out from under the sheet and hits Thorkel, as fast as lightning. He falls back. He's covered with a SHEET and attached to LIFE SUPPORT EQUIPMENT. Octavius moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What hit me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It was so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be fine, Otto. PETER gets off a shot and ducks into the MEN'S room leaving the DOOR ajar for a peak. A WALDO slips down from the SHEET. PETER'S eyes go wide at the sight. What in the hell has happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The URINALS are twisted in bizarre shapes. PIPES are exposed and spout WATER. The MIRRORS look like something out of a funhouse. PETER hears the STRETCHER go by. PETER goes to the DOOR of OCK'S Lab and cracks it. PAN up to the SPIDER, GLOWING softly, dangling from a SHIMMERING STRAND above PETER. As PETER looks out at the STRETCHER, the SPIDER drops on his neck. He reacts by swatting it away. Bad move. The GLOWING SPIDER now squats malevolently on the back of PETER's hand. He stares at it transfixed. It bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!!! PETER throws the SPIDER to the ripply tile floor where it scuttles unsteadily out the door. Sweat starts to bead on PETER'S face. He shakes his head to clear it. His vision becomes uncertain. He lurches against a WEIRD SINK. PETER'S POV is not just uncertain, not just fuzzy, not just moving in and out anamorphically. It's all of that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavily distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing here, kid? PETER turns to see a UNIFORMED GUARD distorted by his crazy vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel a little funny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavily distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, I ain't laughing. Get out... Just get out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bangs open. The GUARD throws PETER out and then throws his BACK PACK at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get yourself over to the Police lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ultra wooz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Police lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER melds into the crowd. As in a dream, JAMESON appears at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, scoop, whaddaya got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... got pictures of the Professor... in there... it's so strange in there... so bizarre...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, kid. Bizarre is what we need. Pick this up in the morning. (holding up his camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be two crisp twenties tucked inside. He hurries off. PETER peers after him and all of a sudden his vision corrects to a perfect focus. The sweat is gone. He's okay. He makes his way through the crowd to the street. We TRACK with PETER as the madding throng recedes behind him. He turns a corner. He hears a SIREN. An AMBULANCE screeches around the corner. It nearly hits PETER who leaps to avoid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER'S cheek is pressed against the brick. He opens his eyes and sees that he's hanging onto the side of the building like a spider. And he's three stories up! He looks down and sees the street thirty feet below him! And the Ambulance which he jumped over is driving away. He tries a downward step, but a BRICK dislodges and crashes to the sidewalk. He takes an upward step. And then another. Tentatively at first, and then with growing confidence, h "crawls" to the roof of the building. At the top he gropes for a RAILING and slips. He dangles eight stories above the street. Then, with a grunt, he vaults to the roof one-handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER is flat on his back, staring at the stars. He sits up and looks wonderingly at his hands. On the back of his right hand are TWO PUNCTURE WOUNDS surrounded by a faint BLUE-WHITE PULSING GLOW. The GLOW disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird. My God, I feel so weird... He leaps to his feet. He flexes. Feels weird. Good Weird. In fact, great weird! He tries a couple of "jumping jacks" and on the third jump he soars into the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhilarated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very weird. The great, bespangled, NEW YORK CITY is his backdrop as PETER jumps and turns and does loops in the air. With the agility and tactility of a spider, PETER leaps from the RAILING to a WALL to a FLAG POLE to another WALL where he lands sideways and sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sideways)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very, very weird. He leaps off the WALL and lands at the edge of the roof. He looks down. No one's looking back. So, he takes a step back and leaps the alley to the next roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER lands on it. The next roof is seven stories up and across the street. PETER bites his lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what the hell!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backlit by a FULL MOON, PETER somersaults to the roof of the taller building, and misses the top! He sticks to the brick FACADE, upside down! He laughs with the moment. A WINDOW opens below him and a pretty BLONDE in a TOWEL sticks her head out. She looks this way and that, and all she sees is a MAN in a LOUD SPORTCOAT down the street. Never thinking to look up, she withdraws into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN in the LOUD SPORTCOAT leans against a LAMP POST and lights a CIGARETTE with a BEAT UP, SILVER PLATED LIGHTER. In the LIGHTER he sees a reflection of PETER leaping off the taller building. He snaps around and looks up in time to see PETER make it to the next FACADE.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: With the UPTOWN SKYLINE behind him, PETER casts caution t the wind and leaps from rooftop to rooftop. Watching from the street, the MAN in the LOUD SPORTCOAT follows PETER'S progress. PETER leaps to a BROWNSTONE and lands amid the WASH. He leaps up to a TENEMENT and lands on a BILLBOARD across which he does a "bug crawl" and leaps again. He touches down on a PIGEON COOP and bounds up and out of frame again. The COOP OWNER, a LATINO in an undershirt and a YANKEES CAP, comes running out of the COOP. He's so surprised that he leaves the DOOR open and twenty WHITE MORNING DOVES fly away in a furious flapping, free at last. The LATINO lets out a stream of Hispanic expletives complete with all the appropriately obscene gestures. PETER slides down a CABLE to a LAMP POST, and swirls down the POLE to a PHONE BOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER comes face to face with the man in the LOUD SPORTCOAT. He gives PETER his CARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a kid who's going places, and I'm gonna point you the right way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Reiss, models, strip dancers, escort girls, blue movies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops... sorry, wrong card. (exchanges cards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Reiss, Talent management.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a big outfit. Got a lot of departments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well... why you approach me? I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes you are... very talented. The three questions of show business success. One do you think you possess a unique talent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two... what are you gonna do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not a clue)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the clincher)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... how much money you got in your pocket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You invest half of that with me and I'll make you a star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about fame. I'm talking about fortune. I'm talking about the chance of a lifetime. How'd you like to be on MTV tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MTV...? Me? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi! It screeches to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid! Tomorrow night. Same place, same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know I'll show up? As the TAXI roars off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the taxi window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you wanna be a star... everybody does. PETER pulls out a QUARTER. And enters a phone booth. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Aunt May?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter? What time is it? Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, I mean yeah I'm fine, but listen... Aunti, the craziest thing happened to me tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As UNCLE BEN stirs fitfully

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lovingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this have to do with a certain girl we talked about at dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, look, there was this radioactive experiment... I was poisoned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was bitten by a bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I get it, you mean a love bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No... A spider...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, did you at least talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt May, listen to me. I got bitten on the hand... by a poisonous spider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was in the bathroom and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you did it in the bathroom? Peter, this is craziness, why don't you use your bed? You're up all night. You're in the radioactive labs. You never take time to eat or sleep. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Aunt May.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you eat something today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Aunt May.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Peter go back to bed, and remember we love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you too, Aunt May. (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, I got a mess of super powers today. Exit booth. He BANGS the PHONE BOOTH. Goes out and-- jumps lightly onto the phone booth roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCK is prepped for surgery. GOWNED PERSONNEL hurry about with a feverish urgency. The CHIEF SURGEON checks the SENSORS attached to OCK'S head. These seasoned professionals are astonished and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these brainwave readings. The mental activity is ten times of any normal man...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Equipment malfunction...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah... his. (checks Ock's chest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... I thought I'd seen everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is beyond medicine. This is madness...! OCK lays bare chested, face up, all FOUR WALDOS splayed. He is a true cyborg. Part man, part machine. Part organic, part molybdenum steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in, blitzed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is so freaky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stern for the staff's sake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, lets stop yakking and get cracking. I want to go in at the upper thoracic. Then we'll work our way around. (slaps Ock's shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang in there, man. INSERT: The WALDO nearest the slap moves ever so slightly The triangular CLAW rotates a quarter turn and then turns back. The NURSE sees it and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glares)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse! Number seven scalpel. Arthroscope stand by. Read out parameters in progress. Let's go in. You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Yes, of course. Everything's online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scalpel! No... no... a larger one... the largest we have! She slaps a HUGE ONE into his palm. He takes a deep breath and goes to work. MASKED heads gather round him. The SCALPEL is poised at the line where skin meets steel. We make an incision. The INSTRUMENTS go crazy. WARNING BELLS and BUZZERS sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill the alarms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going off the chart! A WALDO flashes around the steel leg of the operating TABLE and clanks tight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mop. Mop! Sutures and clamps! Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing him. Defibrillate! A HEART MACHINE is rushed in. They work frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zap him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stabilizing alpha waves... SURGEON #2 applies the CARDIAC SHOCK PADS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a visitor, Doctor... She leaves OCK and THORKEL alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoying this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Octavius, I'm afraid I have bad news for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cyclotron is damaged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What used to be the cyclotron was permanently shut down this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your work is a disaster! Look at yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myself? I don't matter. Nobody matters anymore. To enter a new dimension we must first destroy our own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying? OCK gets off his bed throwing away his sheet waving with his 4 WALDOS and 2 arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroy life. Life is... insignificant. Bags of sleepy, sluggish flesh. What would you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, what are those horrible things sticking from your body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets more and more excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorkel, if I told you that for one moment in time I broke all the laws! For one brief glorious moment, I broke through to the other side. I saw... I felt... I became creation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on Earth are you rambling about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny!!! My destiny! I see it all so clearly now. Universal destruction, yes. All I need is the power... then I can destroy this illusion you call life. It is my destiny to lead us to the light!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are a fool. I will end the universe as you know it. And in that final moment... I'll laugh my ass off while you're kissing yours goodbye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye is right, Octavius... You're fired... sacked... canned. You are history, Doctor Octavius. And I couldn't be more pleased to be the first to tell you this good news... A WALDO shoots up and grabs THORKEL by the throat. He GASPS and SCREAMS silently as the telescoping WALDO lifts him off his feet. He rises until his head is just inches from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his last words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me down Ock... you crazy... MONSTER! Let me down! Then OCK smiles and slams THORKEL'S head through the ceiling. PLASTER rains down. THORKEL'S legs scissor and kick and then go limp. OCK throws his dead body on to the bed, and covers him with the WHITE SHEETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey, dokey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the WINDOW of the TAXI we see MADISON SQUARE GARDEN. As it pulls up, a sign reads, "Midnight Madness! MTV's Rock and Wrestling 'SLAMMY Awards!" The TAXI come to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at the sign)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MTV Wrestling?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the place. Pay the man. MAX REISS gets out, he is carrying a BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. Reiss... I'm not real interested in watching a wrestling match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said anything about watching a wrestling match? You're here to win a wrestling match!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? You must be kidding. REISS hustles PETER inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hop around. You know, the way you did last night. Your opponent gets tired. He falls down. The ref counts to three, you win, and we pick up a thousand bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear the CROWD screaming at something in the background as REISS leads PETER to an employee WASHROOM and shows him the BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really gonna love this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, really, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to know. I know enough for both of us. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A costume... something that fits your talent. Go put it on. I'm sure you'll like it. He slaps the BOX against PETER'S chest and all but pushes him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER takes the suit out of the BOX. It is the SPIDER-MAN SUIT! He looks at it and shrugs. Then he begins to struggle into it. PETER is looking at himself in the MIRROR. He is dressed in all but the MASK. And he looks terrific! He flexes. He smoothes his hair. He's starting to get into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRUSHER COLE is destroying an opponent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REISS winces as the CROWD CHEERS and BOOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it look? I feel like it's Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover your face with the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mystery, my friend. Nobody should know who you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRUSHER COLE is doing a big flexing number and the CROWD is going wild. There are MTV CAMERAS and SIGNS and BANNERS proclaiming the "SLAMMIES" everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, a new challenger, for the thousand dollar fight, weighing in at one hundred and fifty pounds... from parts unknown! Here is the Amazing... Mysterious... Incredible Superman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorts from ringside, hating the name)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not Superman... Spider-Man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Spider-Man!!!!! The CROWD BOOS the slender newcomer who climbs awkwardly through the ropes. Rock music blares. TWIN REDHEADS in RED BIKINIS ring a bell. CRUSHER COLE and SPIDER-MAN circle. COLE is twice SPIDEY'S size. SPIDEY spots a TV CAMERA for the first time. He momentarily freezes. CRUSHER sneers the CRUSHER sneer. Then he charges! With the agility of a spider, SPIDEY leaps out of the way CRUSHER comes back at him. SPIDEY leaps again, bigger! The acrobatics get more and more dramatic as CRUSHER COLE works himself up into a theatrical rage. Taunts erupt from the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill the sucker, Crusher! SPIDEY, really getting into it now, begins playing for th CAMERAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between two blondes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsamatter, Crusher, can't you crush that bug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spidey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Web Face, this is it! He misses SPIDEY again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Crusher, you need a insecticide! (his blondes titter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIZ'S side is all schoolwork. KIM'S side is all ROCK POSTERS and STUFFED ANIMALS. LIZ is curled up doing homework. FLASH and KIM sit on the edge of the bed watching the "SLAMMIES" on MTV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you look at this Spider-Man guy! He is absolutely incredible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, get a load of this outfit! I wish I had it for the Halloween party... it's quite sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you two shush. I'm trying to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The match continues in an increasingly spectacular choreography. CRUSHER bellows at the SCREAMING CROWD. But there's a gleam in his eye. This is it! He charges. SPIDEY, playing the CAMERAS for all he's worth, leaps way, way up. But this time CRUSHER stops dead in his tracks. SPIDER-MAN comes back down into a forearm SMASH that sends him reeling into a corner. CRUSHER does a flying pin. 300 pounds. WOMP! The air leaves SPIDEY in a rush as CRUSHER covers him, smothering him. The CROWD goes WILD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up...! Get up...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two...! Not realizing his own strength and panicky about being squashed, SPIDER-MAN throws CRUSHER COLE off him and up into the air. Way up! Reiss cheers... Spider-Man comes down and knocks CRUSHER for the first time. CRUSHER flies away and out of the arena, eight rows back! The HIPSTER sees CRUSHER coming at him and bolts from his seat. CRUSHER lands on it, in between the TWO BLONDES who break into utter hysterics. SPIDEY, surprised at his own strength, watches CRUSHER land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, history is made today, we have here the first man to win a thousand dollars against the mighty Crusher. The REF raises his hand in victory. The CROWD BOOS and DEBRIS rains down. But some in the CROWD CHEER wildly, recognizing the new sensation. SPIDER-MAN steps down from the right as REISS leads the CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max! Am I really gonna get a thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to get a thousand-- PETER turns with REISS and comes face to face with CRUSHE COLE. Two ominous beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, who are you, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Peter Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is Spider-Man, and I handle him... Whenever you want a rematch call me. Next time it's gonna be ten thousand, what do you say... Crusher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look, Mr. Crusher, I'm really sorry about what happened in there. Really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, I don't know what happened to me tonight... (measures his muscles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... you lost. Big man you lost to the Amazing Spider-Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ARE TIGHT ON A NEW YORK JOURNAL TRUCK. On its SIDE BANNER is a PICTURE of SPIDER-MAN'S face. Headline: "Who is he? Mega-Smash Hits MTV!" The TRUCK pulls away and we see PETER, LIZ, HARRY and KIM standing on the sidewalk waiting to cross. PETER is rocking on his heels and smirking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating truck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking ahead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... he's some clown we saw on TV last night... boy does Flash think he's hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrestling is all bluff. Do you really believe this little guy in a stupid Spider-Man suit beat the Crusher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we better rush... visiting hours will be over soon. INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR & ROOM - DAY The NURSE leads PETER and LIZ and HARRY into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Octavius? You have visitors. Doctor Octavius? We hold for a beat. When LIZ takes a step forward to look around we expect the worst. But nothing grabs her. PETER sees a pile of PLASTER on the floor. He looks up and sees the hole in the ceiling. LIZ and HARRY look up too. OCK is not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ock is not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better call the doctor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better call the police! KIM screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCK, hiding his WALDOS under a white hospital robe. He stalls until he reaches the door. Then one of his WALDOS peaks out and snaps open the new locks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCK, in a white hospital robe walks through the surreal debris. Two WALDOS reach out and "sense" the ripples on opposite WALLS. He runs a hand through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a wreck. What a useless, wasted wreck. Okey, dokey. We rebuild you, my damaged darling. Bigger, better, hotter! A world class, super cyclotron! He hears a NOISE behind him and reacts. And here comes WEINER. Bedraggled, shuffling through the CONTROL ROOM door. He eyeballs the incredible wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, doc... where have you been... whoa this place is messed up. OCK turns, WALDOS writhing. WEINER sees them and kind of ducks, remembering how he was hit by them once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smirks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, doc! You look a little messed up yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been, you imbecile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to the wrestling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrestling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went after the kid. You still want that Parker guy's data, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I followed him... but I lost him in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost him? You--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find him, Maestro... I promise... soon... maybe by tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how was the wrestling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic! There was this new wrestler... beat the mighty Crusher. You won't believe it... a nothing of a guy... calls himself this stupid name... the Amazing Spider-Man... would you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
